alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 4:21PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS EXPECTED ALONG PARTS OF THE SEWARD HIGHWAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT... Snow continues through Turnagain Pass this afternoon with the heaviest snowfall expected overnight tonight. Periods of moderate to heavy snow are expected to continue through at least Friday night. Steady east winds with gusts to 40 mph possible will combine with the snow to reduce visibilities down to one half mile at times. 1 to 2 additional feet of snow are expected over Turnagain Pass. Snow levels will slowly rise during the event, especially during the day Friday. So expect snow to mix with rain at lower elevations. Please check conditions before you go and use caution while traveling. For the latest forecast, visit www.weather.gov/afc. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
